description.other_contributors: Heather Leslie, Atomica Informatics, Australia (openEHR Editor)
description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

Development and preliminary examination of the predictive validity of the Falls Risk Assessment Tool (FRAT) for use in primary care, Journal of Public Health, Volume 26, Issue 2, June 2004, Pages 138–143, https://doi.org/10.1093/pubmed/fdh132
https://www2.health.vic.gov.au/about/publications/policiesandguidelines/falls-risk-assessment-tool
https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/ajag.12476

details.use: FRAT sisältää kolme osiota: Osio 1 - kaatumisriskin status; Osio 2 - riskitekijöiden tarkistuslista; ja Osio 3 - toimintasuunnitelma. Osiota 1 voidaan käyttää kaatumisriskin arviointiin. Tämä arkkityyppi sisältää ainoastaan FRAT työkalusta osion 1.

details.purpose: To record the outcomes of a screening assessment of an individual at risk for falling.
details.keywords: fall, risk, assessment, FRAT, peninsula, screening, falls
details.use:
Use to record the outcomes of a screening assessment of an individual at risk for falling.
Peninsula Health Falls Risk Assessment Tool (PHFRAT) has three sections: Part 1 - falls risk status; Part 2 – risk factor checklist; and Part 3 –action plan. The complete tool (including instructions for use) is a complete falls risk assessment tool. Part 1 is validated as a falls risk screen. This archetype contains only Part 1.

items.items: Falls risk assessment screening tool (PHFRAT - part 1)
Validated Part 1 of the Peninsula Health Falls Risk Assessment Tool (PHFRAT) to screen an individual at risk for falling.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
One or more between 3 and 12 months ago
One or more in last 3 months
One or more in last 3 months whilst inpatient/resident
List of medication classes: Sedatives, Anti-depressants, Anti-Parkinson's, Diuretics, Anti-hypertensives, Hypnotics.
List of conditions: Anxiety, depression, difficulties in cooperation, insight or judgement.
Does not appear to have any of these
Appears mildly affected by one or more
Appears moderately affected by one or more
Appears severely affected by one or more
Subjective assessment of cognitive status or Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS).
Severely impaired or AMTS score 4 or less
The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the four component responses.
The assessment of risk of the patient to fall is inferred from the total score: Low risk: 5-11, medium risk: 12-15, High risk: 16-20.
Assessment of falls status risk, based on the Total score and additional boolean questions.
Recent (or anticipated) changes affecting safe mobility
Recent change in functional status and / or medications affecting safe mobility (or anticipated).
Record as true if recent or anticipated changes are assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status.
Record as true if dizziness or postural hypotension is assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time. (en)
Yksi tai useampi kaatuminen viimeisen 12 kuukauden aikana
*List of medication classes: Sedatives, Anti-depressants, Anti-Parkinson's, Diuretics, Anti-hypertensives, Hypnotics. (en)
*List of conditions: Anxiety, depression, difficulties in cooperation, insight or judgement. (en)
Vaikea-asteista ongelmaa yhdellä tai useammalla osa-alueella
*Subjective assessment of cognitive status or Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS). (en)
Neljästä vastausta varten kirjattujen tietojen yhteispistemäärä.
Potilaan kaatumisriski arvioidaan kokonaispistemäärästä: lievästi kohonnut kaatumisvaara: 5-11, kohonnut kaatumisvaara: 12-15, erittäin korkea kaatumisvaara: 16-20.
*Assessment of falls status risk, based on the Total score and additional boolean questions. (en)
*Recent change in functional status and / or medications affecting safe mobility (or anticipated). (en)
*Record as true if recent or anticipated changes are assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status. (en)
*Record as true if dizziness or postural hypotension is assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status. (en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents. (en)
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time. (en)
Ett eller flera fall under senaste 12 månader
*List of medication classes: Sedatives, Anti-depressants, Anti-Parkinson's, Diuretics, Anti-hypertensives, Hypnotics. (en)
*List of conditions: Anxiety, depression, difficulties in cooperation, insight or judgement. (en)
*Subjective assessment of cognitive status or Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS). (en)
*The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the four component responses. (en)
*The assessment of risk of the patient to fall is inferred from the total score: Low risk: 5-11, medium risk: 12-15, High risk: 16-20. (en)
*Assessment of falls status risk, based on the Total score and additional boolean questions. (en)
*Recent change in functional status and / or medications affecting safe mobility (or anticipated). (en)
*Record as true if recent or anticipated changes are assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status. (en)
*Record as true if dizziness or postural hypotension is assessed as present. If selected this will place the individual automatically into a high risk status. (en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents. (en)
